skill.name: executing-plans
skill.description: Use when you have a written implementation plan to execute in a separate session with review checkpoints
skill.summary: Use when you have a written implementation plan to execute in a separate session with review checkpo...
skill.author: Cygnusfear

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only markdown guidance documentation. No executable code, no file system access, no network calls, and no external command execution. All 8 static findings are false positives triggered by natural language in metadata fields describing standard development practices.

content.value_statement: Large implementation plans can lead to errors when executed without structure. This skill breaks plans into verified batches with human review checkpoints.
actual_capabilities: Load and review implementation plans critically before execution
Execute tasks in configurable batches with default of 3 tasks
Run verifications specified in the plan between batches
Report progress for human review before continuing to next batch
Follow plan steps exactly without skipping verifications
limitations: Requires a pre-written implementation plan file to function
Cannot generate or create plans from scratch (use planning skills)
Does not execute tasks outside the defined plan scope
Default batch size is fixed at 3 tasks but can be adjusted

use_cases.title: Execute feature roadmap
use_cases.description: Follow architecture plans to implement features with built-in code review checkpoints

use_cases.title: Track milestone delivery
use_cases.description: Break large deliverables into batches with verification checkpoints for quality control

use_cases.title: Coordinate complex releases
use_cases.description: Execute phased rollouts with team review between each batch of changes

prompt_templates.title: Start plan execution
prompt_templates.prompt: I'm using the executing-plans skill. Read the plan file at [path] and review it critically. Raise any concerns before proceeding. If no concerns, create TodoWrite and execute the first batch of 3 tasks.

prompt_templates.title: Continue after review
prompt_templates.prompt: I'm using the executing-plans skill. Based on the feedback provided, execute the next batch of 3 tasks from the plan. Follow each step exactly and run verifications.

prompt_templates.title: Handle blocker
prompt_templates.prompt: I'm using the executing-plans skill. I've hit a blocker: [describe blocker]. Stop execution and ask for clarification rather than guessing the solution.

prompt_templates.title: Complete and transition
prompt_templates.prompt: I'm using the executing-plans skill. All tasks are complete and verified. Now I'm using the finishing-a-development-branch skill to complete this work properly.

output_examples.input: Execute the user authentication plan in batches
output: Executed batch 1 (tasks 1-3): Implemented user model, created auth routes, added password hashing
Ready for feedback before continuing to batch 2
Identified concern: backup strategy not specified
Proceeding with first batch after confirmation
Executed batch 2 (tasks 4-6): Added API endpoints, configured rate limiting
Tests passing for all new code

best_practices: Always review the plan critically before starting to catch potential issues early
Report verification output clearly so reviewers can assess implementation quality
Stop and ask for clarification when encountering blockers rather than guessing
anti_patterns: Skipping verifications to speed up progress
Guessing solutions when instructions are unclear
Continuing past a batch without waiting for human feedback

faq.question: What AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code for implementation tasks.

faq.question: What is the default batch size?
faq.answer: Three tasks per batch by default. Adjust based on plan complexity.

faq.question: Does this skill integrate with other skills?
faq.answer: Yes. Use with finishing-a-development-branch for final verification and completion.

faq.question: Is my plan data safe?
faq.answer: This is a prompt-only skill. No data is stored or transmitted externally.

faq.question: What if verification fails?
faq.answer: Stop immediately and ask for clarification. Do not continue past failed verifications.

faq.question: How is this different from automatic execution?
faq.answer: Requires human review between batches for quality control and course correction.
